newsitem.title: USA: NYSE April 7-11 program trading 14.5 pct of volume.
newsitem.headline: NYSE April 7-11 program trading 14.5 pct of volume.

text.p: The New York Stock Exchange said Thursday that program trading amounted to 14.5 percent of its average daily volume for the week of April 7-11.
The exchange said the trading comprised 64.9 million shares of the 447.5 million average daily volume.
It did not give comparative figures.
Brokerage firms BNP Securities, Natwest, Susquehanna Brokerage Services, Salomon Brothers and Goldman Sachs reported the most program activity, it said.

In all markets, program trading averaged 92.9 million shares a day for the week, about 69.9 percent of which occurred on the exchange, 23.5 percent in foreign markets and 6.6 percent in other U.S. markets like the Nasdaq.
Program trading encompasses a wide range of portfolio-trading strategies involving the purchase or sale of a basket of at least 15 stocks with a total value of $1 million or more, the exchange said.
